page.title: 08LOVERSALL HOSPITAL DONCASTER
page.content: The Hospital treats problems related to mental health. The patients can get up almost when they want as they can get breakfast until 8.45 am. After breakfast there are many activities for the patients. Some of these such as housework and selfcare are helpful for rehabilitation but some are hobbies such as snooker, darts and painting. Lunch is served between 12 and 1 pm. Activities are carried on in the afternoon until dinner between 6 and 6.45 pm. There is no fixed bedtime and patients can watch late T.V. The 80 day patients arrive at 9 am and leave at 4 pm. Concerts, holidays and trips are often arranged and contact with and by the community is fostered.
